column4: hello, I just did an upgrade from version 9.04 to 9.10 but now my Wireless hardware is not fully recognized. I am using the SMC 2835W EU (not v2) PC card
and it worked fine in 9.04 yes?  Well many people have experienced problems after upgrading 9.04 to 9.10.

well  not much in 9.10  that is worth it end user featurewise, as in stuff you see.   It's still ok to run 9.04,  it has  about a year of support left,   plus  10.04 will be out at the end of April which is the next Long Term Support version,  which has to be pretty good, or I have a feeling quite a few people wil be leaving Ubuntu
If it worked fine in 9.04,  not much point really trying to configure it in 9.10 in my opinion,  just put 9.04 back on.   Or even try some other distros if you want.
also calling 9.04 a downgrade isn't  quite right, because with Ubuntu it's not about what is the latest version or  the Long Term Support version,  it's about which releases are still supported
sometimes an older version is going to be better for a user, beasue of the user them selves, or their hardware, or both
Well I suggest checking out the release notes when a new version comes out
Then you can also make a more educated decision if your going to upgrade or not.
Plus if you wait a bit  you can check out this channel for the issues.
Before  you  get it yourself or not.

Yes that's something else you can do  test it,  on a spare computer,  or in a virtual machine or whatever, whilst  it's in development,  I have been doing this since Alpha 4 on this one, so got boot up issues still, but when I get round to installing the final,  that should go away.   It's looking like the weekend when I do OS stuff on this computer.

,but from what I have seen of 9.10 I am not impressed, so  i'll be keeping the other computer on 9.04 for now.   Plus  how if I upgrade it I might get issues, and I don't feel like clean installing Ubuntu any time soon on there.
sounds like an old version of  a VMware product
not sure what versions they are currently on
plus most people recommend Virtualbox in here
